The growing rift within the House Democratic Caucus is no excuse for failing to stand in support of Israel, our greatest ally in the Middle East. It is time for Congress to stand against the toxic BDS movement. https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/mitch-mcconnell-and-kevin-mccarthy-the-house-must-stand-against-the-toxic-bds-movement/2019/05/14/413e24ee-75bc-11e9-bd25-c989555e7766_story.html?utm_campaign=feb966afe4-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_01_29_06_11_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_source=2018%20House%20GOP%20Staff%20List&utm_term=.148b858fc1d0 …
The fact is, H.R. 336 is bipartisan and it has already passed the United States Senate overwhelmingly with a super-majority.

Yesterday, I signed a discharge petition to bring H.R. 336 to the floor for consideration by the House. It is a simple choice for Speaker Pelosi and House Democrats: do they stand with our ally Israel or with the antisemitism that has become all too common in their caucus?
